title: Krept breaks silence after being ‘slashed’ at BBC Radio 1Xtra Live
text:
Krept is recovering after the attack (Picture: Redferns)

Krept has spoken out for the first time after he was ‘slashed’ backstage at BBC Radio 1Xtra Live this weekend.

The 29-year-old rapper, from the rap duo Krept & Konan, was injured during an altercation at the music event in Birmingham on Saturday night (5 October), and received medical support on-site but was not taken to hospital.

West Midlands Police did not name the man who was injured but social media rumours suggested Krept was the party involved.

Speaking out for the first time, Krept – real name Casyo Johnson – tweeted on Sunday: ‘My people thanks for the messages Im good, ill be back in no time. God was with me trust me. Cant keep a good man down [sic].’

Earlier, his rap partner Konan had simply tweeted: ‘Bros good,’ while their friend Kritikal added: ‘Bro is good,’ with the prayer and heart emojis.

This year’s BBC Radio 1Xtra Live was cut short not long after AJ Tracey’s performance, due to the incident backstage.

Confirming the altercation, West Midlands police said in a statement: ‘It’s understood that a man sustained a slash wound during the assault. He was treated by on site medical staff and did not require hospital treatment.’

BBC 1Xtra also addressed the incident in a series of tweets, stating: ‘Following an isolated serious incident, we have had to stop 1Xtra Live in Birmingham. ‘We are co-operating fully with the police to establish what has happened.’

They continued: ‘We’re sorry to everyone who attended 1Xtra Live in Birmingham for the early finish, however the health and safety of everyone involved is always our top priority.

‘We are upset and saddened that something like this should happen to a guest at one of our events and we remain in close contact and continue to offer our full support.’

A separate brawl also unfolded in the audience between various groups, which was caught on video.

Wizkid had been due to headline the concert, which took place at Arena Birmingham and also had the likes of French Montana and Aitch on the line-up.
